title.value: How To Start A Labdoo Laptop?

body.value:
User Accounts
Each laptop (cloned or installed using install-scripts) is preinstalled with 3 user accounts. When logging in click on the small triangle right from labdoo --> this will show you a list of currently available user accounts:
labdoo: has super user rights / is administrator! The log-in password is labdoo (Please change this password when login for the first time. labdoo is an administrator account and have all the access right on the computer. Working under this account without a proper knowledge may crash the system! Therefore, it is recommended to have only teachers know the password of the user labdoo)
student: is a standard user account for students. The password is also labdoo (You can decide to change the current password or not.)
guest: is an account which doesn’t require a password to log in. All data will be automatically erased after the user log off from this account
Other Log In Options
Optional: select one of the pre-instaled desktops (user interface) Important! When typing in the password, make sure that the keyboard layout matches with your keyboard! Optional: Enlarge font size or improve contrast, if user is visually impaired
To change the password → System Tools → users and groups → +Add (to add a new user) or change → password „labdoo“ → change it → ok
Manage Groups → to group users (e.g. group labdoo)
To Start a Program
There are many useful, fun and educational software and games installed. To start a program:
Click on the lower left corner on the Lubuntu icon (similar to Windows XP) → “Education” or "game“ → click on the program you want to start it.
In the folder of “/Public”, you will find a lot of useful reference manuals, such as OER, Offline wikis, e-books etc.
There are also a video introductory and an Offline wikipedia (Xowa) available on the desktop.
==
Optional: Desktops (user interfaces)
A Labdoo laptop comes with Lubuntu (Linux operating system based on Ubuntu and the LXDE desktop). LXDE is an easy to learn user interface, lean, fastl. LXDE / Lubuntu can be installed on older laptops, from 256 / 512 MB RAM.
Optional you are able to install other desktops, but they ask for more hardware resources -
Unity: fast hardware needed (min 1 GB RAM)
Gnome: medium to fast hardware needed (756 MB - 1 GB RAM)
language, regional formats and keyboard settings (please adjust when online)
Depending on the country of the edoovillage you may want to install one or more additional language(s) or keyboard(s).
Click Preferences → Language Support. Sometimes you get the message “Language support not completely installed, install now” → confirm by "Yes" and install.
In the next window click → Install/Remove languages → select the language(s) needed → Apply → Apply System-wide.
The new languages will show up in the language list above: Lubuntu first tries to find a word in this table in language no. 1, next in language no. 2 and so on, and will stop using English.
To change priority of the languages → mark the new language → right mouse click on new language, keep on pressing right mouse button → move the language to its position, drop it → click Apply System-wide. The new language will be used after logout and login or reboot of the computer.
Regional formats
You can also adjust the local currency, notation of numbers, date and time (if available). Click tab „Regional formats“ and select format in the list shown → Apply System-Wide.
keyboard settings
If the laptop was cloned using images you can go ahead. Otherwise you have to add a panel item to the task bar → right mouse click on the task bar → Add / Remove Panel Items → +Add → select "Keyboard Layout Handler" → +Add → optional: move the item position within the task bar by Up or Down.
Right mouse click on the symbol "de" (keyboard layout handler) in the task bar (or another country abreviation shown) → Keyboard Layout handler Settings → Remove the hook "Keep system layout", if activated (otherwise you are not able to add new layouts) →
+Add → Add a new keyboard layout -Remove → Remove a keyboard layout up → Move a keyboard layout entry in the list up down → Move a keyboard layout entry in the list up
The number of keyboard layout entries is limited to 4 (four).
Manuals, video tutorials and more
For manuals, video tutorials, offline wikis etc. open the folder /home/labdoo/Public/. Or click on the icon "videos" on the desktop to open the video tutorials folder. A video can be watched using Firefox or a player (view -> 1/2 size, zoom +/-).
Have fun learning and playing with your Labdoo laptop! The Labdoo team
